A pizza is typically made with a dough base, tomato sauce, cheese, and other toppings such as meats, vegetables, and herbs. The dough is usually prepared by combining flour, water, yeast, and salt. The dough is then kneaded and rolled out into a thin crust. The tomato sauce is then spread over the crust and cheese is added. Finally, the other toppings are added and the pizza is baked in an oven until the cheese is melted and lightly browned.

A pizza is typically made by spreading a layer of dough on a pizza pan, then topping it with a sauce, cheese, and other ingredients. The pizza is then baked in an oven until the cheese is melted and the crust is golden brown.
